definition: to exhale/to blow off steam/(phonetics) aspirated
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Today China is proud and elated.
Breathe chaotically through the nose, concentrating always on exhalation. The body will take care of the inhalation.
sentences.chinese: 快速地透過鼻子吸氣與吐氣，重點放在吐氣上。

sentences.english: Breathe chaotically through the nose, concentrating always on exhalation. The body will take care of the inhalation.
sentences.chinese: 快速地透過鼻子吸氣與吐氣，重點放在吐氣上。

sentences.english: The Chinese people feel proud and elated for the great economic development/growth in China. The Chinese people feel proud and elated for China’s great economic development/growth.
sentences.chinese: 中國經濟取得巨大發展，中國人民終於揚眉吐氣了。

sentences.english: When he breathed out his eyes disappeared momentarily behind a haze of hashish .
sentences.chinese: 當他吐氣時，他的眼睛立刻消失在大麻的煙霧中。

sentences.english: I must treat the transparent glass to aspirate gently .
sentences.chinese: 我要對著透明的玻璃輕輕吐氣。

sentences.english: I have a successful career, such as the day is when I feel elated.
sentences.chinese: 等我事業有成的那天，也就是我揚眉吐氣的時候。

sentences.english: Your sweet breath mixed with the aroma of Champagne allowed me be capable to endure the long lone black night.
sentences.chinese: 你吐氣若蘭，混着香檳的芳香，讓我度過寂寞長夜。

sentences.english: Rhodium-plated necklace with a Moonlight crystal in the exclusive Elated cut.
sentences.chinese: 銠鍍金項鍊與月光晶體在獨家揚眉吐氣，削減。

sentences.english: Rhodium-plated drop pierced earrings with a Moonlight crystal in the exclusive Elated cut.
sentences.chinese: 銠鍍下降，穿耳環與月光晶體在獨家揚眉吐氣，削減。

sentences.english: But then our fans erupted when we scored.
sentences.chinese: 當我們進球之後我們的球迷就揚眉吐氣了。

sentences.english: At continued last China can avowal of a tennis player in a Grand Slam final.
sentences.chinese: 中國終於能夠在網球大滿貫賽上揚眉吐氣了。

sentences.english: Now you have been acquitted on all the charges, you can hold your head high.
sentences.chinese: 現在你已被宣判無罪，你可以揚眉吐氣了。

sentences.english: Measure your waist just after you breathe out.
sentences.chinese: 在吐氣放鬆後測量腰圍。

sentences.english: Simply close your eyes and breathe in through your nose and out through your mouth.
sentences.chinese: 只須閉上眼睛，用鼻子深吸氣，然後從嘴裏吐氣。

definition: to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
lit. to breathe out stale air and breathe in fresh (idiom, from Zhuangzi 庄子); fig. to get rid of the old and bring in the new
to draw to oneself/to gather up/to collect/to fold up (an umbrella, wings etc)/to assemble (a party of persons)/to rope in (some people)
to feel suffocated or oppressed/to choke with resentment/to feel injured or resentful
top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
